channel.title: Internet on linux SUSE?
channel.description:
Anybody know how to get internet working for linux SUSE? I got it to connect to my router (192.168.1.1), and the router tells me the internet is working, but when I search google, or moparisthebest, it shows immediatley as an error connecting to page..
Anybody know how to fix this?

item.title: Internet on linux SUSE?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

DeadBird:

192.168.1.1 should be it…

I Know the primary DNS should be 192.168.1.1… But I don’t know where to configure it. Telling me the console code/User interface would help…

Read full topic

item.title: Internet on linux SUSE?
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

192.168.1.1 should be it…

Read full topic

item.title: Internet on linux SUSE?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:2, topic:40581”]Try going into the console, and typing “ping 72.14.207.99”.

If that works, then it’s a DNS problem and you need to tell SUSE what the ip for your ISP’s DNS server is. If that doesn’t work, post back here.[/quote]

The ping works… It connected and sucesfully brought back a ping of about 22.3ms 100 times. I got the default gateway set, but I need to get the primary DNS and Secondary DNS set up… Where could I set them both up? (They are both on 0.0.0.0)

Read full topic

item.title: Internet on linux SUSE?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Try going into the console, and typing “ping 72.14.207.99”.

If that works, then it’s a DNS problem and you need to tell SUSE what the ip for your ISP’s DNS server is. If that doesn’t work, post back here.

Read full topic
